intro: Glinus astrolasion, commonly known as the starry glinus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture. Glinus astrolasion is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
